author: Maher Saleh
title: Front-end
body: This is what users interact with directly, including the website's layout, design, and user experience. Technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js are commonly used.

author: Maher Saleh
title: Back-end
body: This is where the magic happens behind the scenes. The server, database, and application logic come together here, powered by technologies like Node.js, Python (Django/Flask), or PHP.

author: Maher Saleh
title: Learn the Basics
body: start with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. These are the foundations of web development.

author: Maher Saleh
title: Learn the Basics
body: start with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. These are the foundations of web development.

author: Maher Saleh
title: Dive into Frameworks
body: Explore front-end frameworks like React or Angular for building dynamic user interfaces.

author: Maher Saleh
title: Understand Back-end Development
body: Learn server-side languages like Node.js, Python, or Ruby, and understand APIs.

author: Maher Saleh
title: Master Databases
body: Work with SQL (MySQL/PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (MongoDB) databases to store and retrieve data.

author: Maher Saleh
title: Practice, Practice, Practice
body: Build projects, contribute to open source, and participate in coding challenges.

author: Maher Saleh
title: Code Editors
body: Visual Studio Code is a favorite among developers for its versatility and extensions.

author: Maher Saleh
title: Version Control
body: Git and GitHub allow developers to track changes and collaborate effectively.

author: Maher Saleh
title: Package Managers
body: Tools like npm or Yarn make managing dependencies easier.

author: Maher Saleh
title: Deployment Platforms
body: Platforms like Netlify, Vercel, or AWS make deploying your projects seamless.
